doc.title: Mao Geping
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Best-of-breed growth more share gains to come reiterate BuyBest-of-breed growth more share gains to come reiterate Buy(2)_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 125.00 HKD | Price: 94.05 HKD

Mao Geping's (MGP) revenue/NPAT was \(+31\% +36\%\) in 1H25, in line with its flash results (see report: 1H25 flash result ahead of full- year run- rate). Such revenue/NPAT growth is the fastest among domestic beauty peers. So, we lift our 2025E/26E EPS by \(4\% /6\%\) , but maintain our PO of HK\\$125 (with a lower target multiple of 33x given sector de- rating). The share price was \(- 26\%\) since early June (vs. MXCIN: \(+11\%\) ) given conservative view on China beauty industry growth and international brands' recovery at the cost of domestic ones, and sector rotation out of new consumption. The stock now trades at 28x 2026E P/E, which we believe is justified given its \(30\%\) EPS CAGR over 2025- 27E. We see robust growth outlook: (1) from facial makeup to other makeup segments; (2) from makeup to skincare: skincare serves as another growth engine, leveraging the company's strong customer base of makeup to enable cross- sell opportunities; and (3) from offline to online. MGP's online offerings of smaller sized, lower priced SKUs could expand its consumer base, instead of cannibalizing offline sales. We reiterate Buy on MGP's solid growth outlook, above- peer ROE, and scarcity value given broad- base consumption weakness.

MGP's revenue was \(+31\%\) YoY in 1H25. By category, skincare/makeup/others were \(+33\% / + 31\% / - 6\%\) YoY to account for \(42\% /55\% /3\%\) of total sales. By channel, online/offline was \(+39\% / + 27\%\) YoY, with online accounting for over half of business \((51\%)\) for the first time. Offline growth was built on both store expansion \((+9\%\) YoY to 405 counters) and SSsG \((+18\%\) YoY largely driven by traffic, with ticket size remaining largely stable at RMB1,280). Increasing repurchase rate (from \(25\%\) to \(27\%\) ) and rising contribution from hero products contributed to the strong top- line growth. GPM was - 70bp to \(84.2\%\) , largely on new makeup SKUs (with lower margin) and artistry training margin contraction on higher staff cost and absence of pre- examination training fee. SG&A ratio was - 385bp largely on operating leverage. It is worth noticing that S&D expense/revenue declined from \(47.5\%\) in 1H24 to \(45.2\%\) in 1H25, while most other domestic firms saw rising marketing spending. As a result, OP was \(+36\%\) YoY, with OPM \(+112bp\) to \(34.6\%\) .
\\* For full definitions of Qmethod measures, see page 9.

Cosmetics/Personal Care

Company DescriptionMao Geping is the leading Chinese premium beauty group, founded in 2000 by a renowned makeup artist in China's beauty industry, Mr. Mao. The core brand MAOGEPING is the only domestic name among the top- 10 premium beauty groups in China, ranking seventh based on total retail sales in 2023 with market share of \(1.8\%\) , according to Frost & Sullivan. The Mao family collectively holds \(70.5\%\) of the company. The company was listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange on 10 Dec 2024.

We rate Mao Geping as Buy. We believe Mao Geping is set to ride on industry recovery with share- gain opportunities on both category and channel expansion. Its unique positioning with balanced channel mix, higher- than- peers' exposure to facial makeup, and its oriental aesthetics allows it to better weather the headwinds from competition.
Exhibit 1: Mao Geping: Earnings revision We lift our 2025E/26E EPS by \(4\% /6\%\)
Source: Company, BofA Global Research estimates

We lift our 2025E/26E EPS by \(4\% /6\%\) but maintain our PO of HK\$125. Our PO of HK\$125 is based on a 50/50 blend of P/E and DCF valuations. Our P/E- based value is HK\$119, based on 33x 2026 P/E (was 36x) on sector de- rating. Our DCF- based valuation is HK\$130, applying \(11\%\) WACC (3% risk- free rate, 9% market premium, 1x beta and \(90\% /10\%\) weight of equity/debt), and 4% terminal growth rate (unchanged).

OP: operating profit  NPAT: Net profit after tax  GPM/OPM/NPM: gross/operating/net profit margin  SKU: stock keeping unit  MXCN: MXCI China  SG&A: Selling, general, and administrative expenses  S&D: selling and distribution

Our PO of HK\$125 is based on a 50/50 blend of P/E and DCF valuations. Our P/E- based value is HK\$119, based on 33x 2026 P/E given sector derating. Our DCF- based valuation is HK\$130, applying \(11\%\) WACC (3% risk- free rate, 9% market premium, 1x beta and 90%/10% weight of equity/debt), and 4% terminal growth rate. We also assume HKDCNY FX rate at 0.92.
Downside risks: macro and demand weakness, consumer preference, competition, innovation and development, single- brand dependency, shareholder sell- off, and key personnel risk.

iQmethod is the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of iQmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls. iQtobase is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research. iQprofile, iQmethod are service marks of Bank of America Corporation. iQtobase is a registered service mark of Bank of America Corporation.
